# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Special Instructions

None.

Sure, here is the function in Julia language. This function adds a new column to the dataframe that combines the year and month from the existing `dt` column into a string format "yyyymm".

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.format(x, "yyyyMM"), df[:dt])
    return df
end
```
The `map` function applies a given function to each element in an iterable (like a column of the DataFrame). The function we pass to it (`Dates.format(x, "yyyyMM")`) formats a DateTime as a string where "yyyy" stands for the year and "MM" stands for the month.

You can use this function like so:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt = [DateTime(2021, 3, 4), DateTime(2022, 5, 6)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will add a new column `:ym` to the DataFrame with values "202103" and "202205", corresponding to March of 2021 and May of 2022 respectively.
